reviews.review: Overall a good game, queues are somewhat long however that isn't something the developers can control. Some perks, especially for killers (namely BBQ & Chili) are considered necessary for some play styles yet they're DLC locked with the occasional appearance in the Shrine of Secrets. Overall would recommend, I'm able to pour hours into this game and have something to do almost all of the time, plus it makes for good games with friends.

This game made me leave the comfort zone of my single player games, and just enjoy a quick match (or several) of adrenaline. Granted it's not perfect the developers are always bringing something new to it keeping our interest, and it works every time in my case. The community can be toxic sometimes, but you can always pass on the chat and move on to the next match; if you just play games to have fun like I do, you might end up enjoying it, who knows... :)

Dead by Daylight isn't the most friendly game for new players. It takes on average 300+ hours of play time to truly understand mechanics, map layout, items, perks, etc. Once you come out on the other side of it though it can be a really fun game... at times. The toxicity of the community will always be one of it's major problems, that and the dev's. The dev's continue to release broken patch, after broken patch and have a really hard time being transparent about the direction they want to take the game. It also feels like for the most part the dev's don't really listen to the player base when it comes to feedback on the PTB (Public Test Build). I'm addicted though so until a better asymmetrical horror comes along I will be spending most of gaming hours here.

Other than that the game is fine, is a fun chaotic experience that rewards cooperating with your teammates and thinking what the survivors will do as killer.

Community has it's ups and downs and the game has it's inconsistencies but it is constistently challenging, fun and engaging. It's quite the addictive horror co-op game and I don't see myself putting it down anytime soon.
